meanings.definition: The process of renovating and improving a neighborhood, often resulting in the displacement of lower-income residents.
meanings.sent1: Gentrification can change a neighborhood by fixing up old buildings.
meanings.sent2: The gentrification of the area brought in new shops and cafes.
meanings.sent3: The gentrification of the town made the old residents feel out of place.
meanings.sent4: The gentrification of the street turned it into a completely different place.
meanings.sent5: Gentrification can push people out of their homes due to rising costs.

meanings.definition: The act of making a neighborhood more attractive to wealthier residents, typically leading to increased property values.
meanings.sent1: Gentrification often leads to higher prices in the area.
meanings.sent2: The gentrification of the neighborhood attracted wealthier families.
meanings.sent3: The gentrification of the block made the real estate agents happy.
meanings.sent4: The gentrification of the city made it a hotspot for the rich.
meanings.sent5: Gentrification can transform a neighborhood into a luxury destination.
